Annotation.description: An annotation is an assertion made in relation to one or more objects.

createdBy.description: The identity that created a characterization of a concept.

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

externalReference.description: Specifies a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

hasFacet.description: Further sets of properties characterizing a concept based on the particular context of the class and of the particular instance of the concept being characterized.

modifiedTime.description: Specifies the time that this particular version of the object was modified. The object creator can use the time it deems most appropriate as the time this version of the object was modified. The value of the modified property for a given object version MUST be later than or equal to the value of the created property. Object creators MUST update the modified property when creating a new version of an object. The modified timestamp MUST be precise to the nearest millisecond (exactly three digits after the decimal place in seconds).

name.description: The name of a particular concept characterization.

objectCreatedTime.description: The time at which a characterization of a concept is created. This time pertains to the time of creating the record object, and is not an intrinsic characteristic of the concept.

objectMarking.description: Marking definitions to be applied to a particular concept characterization in its entirety.

specVersion.description: The version of UCO ontology or subontology specification used to characterize a concept.

statement.description: A textual statement of an assertion.

Annotation.title: Annotation

Bundle.description: A bundle is a container for a grouping of UCO content with no presumption of shared context.

ConfidenceFacet.description: A confidence is a grouping of characteristics unique to an asserted level of certainty in the accuracy of some information.

confidence.description: An asserted level of certainty in the accuracy of some information.

ContextualCompilation.description: A contextual compilation is a grouping of things sharing some context (e.g., a set of network connections observed on a given day, all accounts associated with a given person).

ControlledVocabulary.description: A controlled vocabulary is an explicitly constrained set of string values.

constrainingVocabularyName.description: The name of an explicitly constrained set of string values.

constrainingVocabularyReference.description: A reference to a specification for an explicitly constrained set of string values. The specification may be unstructured (e.g., web page listing string values) or structured (e.g. RDF/OWL enumeration).

ExternalReference.description: Characteristics of a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

definingContext.description: A description of the context relevant to the definition of a particular external reference identifier.

externalIdentifier.description: An identifier for some information defined external to the UCO context.

referenceURL.description: A URL for some information defined external to the UCO context.

ExternalReference.title: ExternalReference

GranularMarking.description: A granular marking is a grouping of characteristics unique to specification of MarkingDefinitions (restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how data can be used and shared) that apply to particular portions of a particular UCO object.

contentSelectors.description: "Explicit specification of exactly which portions of a UCO object to apply MarkingDefinitions to.  Specific syntax for how to specify the UCO object portions is dependent on the particular syntactic serialization implementation (XML, JSON, etc.) of UCO and MUST be explicitly specified in a separate binding specification for that syntactic serialization implementation (e.g. a UCO XML Binding Specification)."

marking.description: Represents specific MarkingDefinitions to be applied to UCO data.

GranularMarking.title: GranularMarking

Grouping.description: A grouping is a compilation of referenced UCO content with a shared context.

context.description: A description of particular contextual affinity.

IdentityAbstraction.description: An identity abstraction is a grouping of identifying characteristics unique to an individual or organization. This class is an ontological structural abstraction for this concept. Implementations of this concept should utilize the identity:Identity class.

LicenseMarking.description: A MarkingDefinition is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of a specific data marking conveying restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how marked data can be used and shared.

definitionType.description: Specifies the Marking Model for a Marking Definition.

license.description: Specifies the identifier for the type of license

LicenseMarking.title: LicenseMarking

MarkingDefinition.description: A MarkingDefinition is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of a specific data marking conveying restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how marked data can be used and shared.

createdBy.description: The identity that created a characterization of a concept.

definition.description: Explicit specification of a data marking instance.

definitionType.description: Specifies the Marking Model for a Marking Definition.

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

MarkingDefinitionAbstraction.description: A marking definition abstraction is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of a specific data marking conveying restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how marked data can be used and shared. This class is an ontological structural abstraction for this concept. Implementations of this concept should utilize the marking MarkingDefinition class.

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

externalReference.description: Specifies a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

MarkingModel.description: A MarkingModel is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of a particular form of data MarkingDefinitions (restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how data can be used and shared)
MarkingModel.title: MarkingModel

ModusOperandi.description: A modus operandi is a particular method of operation (how a particular entity behaves or the resources they use).

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

externalReference.description: Specifies a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

Relationship.description: A relationship is a grouping of characteristics unique to an assertion that one or more objects are related to another object in some way.

createdBy.description: The identity that created a characterization of a concept.

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

endTime.description: The ending time of a time range.

externalReference.description: Specifies a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

hasFacet.description: Further sets of properties characterizing a concept based on the particular context of the class and of the particular instance of the concept being characterized.

isDirectional.description: A specification whether or not a relationship assertion is limited to the context FROM a source object(s) TO a target object.

kindOfRelationship.description: A characterization of the nature of a relationship between objects.

modifiedTime.description: Specifies the time that this particular version of the object was modified. The object creator can use the time it deems most appropriate as the time this version of the object was modified. The value of the modified property for a given object version MUST be later than or equal to the value of the created property. Object creators MUST update the modified property when creating a new version of an object. The modified timestamp MUST be precise to the nearest millisecond (exactly three digits after the decimal place in seconds).

name.description: The name of a particular concept characterization.

objectCreatedTime.description: The time at which a characterization of a concept is created. This time pertains to the time of creating the record object, and is not an intrinsic characteristic of the concept.

objectMarking.description: Marking definitions to be applied to a particular concept characterization in its entirety.

source.description: The originating node of a specified relationship.

specVersion.description: The version of UCO ontology or subontology specification used to characterize a concept.

startTime.description: The initial time of a time range.

target.description: The terminating node of a specified relationship.

Relationship.title: Relationship

ReleaseToMarking.description: A release-to marking is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of data MarkingDefinitions (restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how data can be used and shared) to convey details of authorized persons and/or organizations to which to the associated content may be released. The existence of the Release-To marking restricts access to ONLY those identities explicitly listed, regardless of whether another data marking exists that allows sharing with other members of the community.

authorizedIdentities.description: Specifies the identities that are authorized to access the data to which the data marking is associated.  The list of authorized identities are represented as UUIDs.

definitionType.description: Specifies the Marking Model for a Marking Definition.

ReleaseToMarking.title: ReleaseToMarking

StatementMarking.description: A statement marking is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of data MarkingDefinitions (restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how data can be used and shared) to convey details of a textual marking statement, (e.g., copyright) whose semantic meaning should apply to the associated content. Statement markings are generally not machine-readable. An example of this would be a simple marking to apply copyright information, such as 'Copyright 2014 Acme Inc.'.

definitionType.description: Specifies the Marking Model for a Marking Definition.

statement.description: Specifies the statement to apply to the structure for which the Marking is to be applied.

StatementMarking.title: StatementMarking

TermsOfUseMarking.description: A terms of use marking is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of data MarkingDefinitions (restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how data can be used and shared) to convey details of a textual statement specifying the Terms of Use (that is, the conditions under which the content may be shared, applied, or otherwise used) of the marked content. An example of this would be used to communicate a simple statement, such as 'Acme Inc. is not responsible for the content of this file'.

definitionType.description: Specifies the Marking Model for a Marking Definition.

termsOfUse.description: Specifies the terms of use that apply to the structure for which the Marking is to be applied.

TermsOfUseMarking.title: TermsOfUseMarking

UcoInherentCharacterizationThing.description: A UCO inherent characterization thing is a grouping of characteristics unique to a particular inherent aspect of a UCO domain object.
UcoInherentCharacterizationThing.title: UcoInherentCharacterizationThing

UcoObject.description: A UCO object is a representation of a fundamental concept either directly inherent to the cyber domain or indirectly related to the cyber domain and necessary for contextually characterizing cyber domain concepts and relationships. Within the Unified Cyber Ontology (UCO) structure this is the base class acting as a consistent, unifying and interoperable foundation for all explicit and inter-relatable content objects.

createdBy.description: The identity that created a characterization of a concept.

description.description: A human-readable description of an entity

externalReference.description: Specifies a reference to a resource outside of the UCO.

hasFacet.description: Further sets of properties characterizing a concept based on the particular context of the class and of the particular instance of the concept being characterized.

modifiedTime.description: Specifies the time that this particular version of the object was modified. The object creator can use the time it deems most appropriate as the time this version of the object was modified. The value of the modified property for a given object version MUST be later than or equal to the value of the created property. Object creators MUST update the modified property when creating a new version of an object. The modified timestamp MUST be precise to the nearest millisecond (exactly three digits after the decimal place in seconds).

objectCreatedTime.description: The time at which a characterization of a concept is created. This time pertains to the time of creating the record object, and is not an intrinsic characteristic of the concept.

objectMarking.description: Marking definitions to be applied to a particular concept characterization in its entirety.

specVersion.description: The version of UCO ontology or subontology specification used to characterize a concept.

UcoObject.title: UcoObject
